after.name: cusi_case
after.comment: A table used to store suggested investigations to be shown to a checkuser. Used by the the Suggested investigations feature of the CheckUser extension.

columns.name: sic_status
columns.comment: Integer acting as an enum, which represents the status of this case. Open is 0, Closed as resolved is 1, Closed as invalid is 2

columns.name: sic_status_reason
columns.comment: The reason given for changing sic_status to either closed as resolved (1) or closed as invalid (2).

columns.name: sic_created_timestamp
columns.comment: The timestamp representing when the case was created by the system.

indexes.name: sic_status_created_timestamp_id
indexes.comment: Used for several things. Allows sorting and paging the Codex table by the 'Status' column (the created timestamp and ID are used to ensure unique paging). Also allows the system to find the newest open case given a pre-determined list of sic_id values, so the system can add new users to an existing case.

indexes.name: sic_created_timestamp_id
indexes.comment: Used to sort and page cases by their creation timestamp (the ID makes paging consistent in case two cases have the same creation timestamp) for the Codex table on the Special page for Suggested investigations.
